notes: Torvun Kell appointed Chief Surveyor. Institutes quarterly reporting system.
Kell retires after documenting accelerating SW deterioration.
Thurmond Gast begins service with the Capital Cartographic Authority.
Tross joins the Western Archive as a junior surveyor, bringing his cartographic training's emphasis on relational thinking. His approach would later become the foundation of the Constellation Method.
Rellen Voss joins the Western Archive as junior surveyor. While others focus on stable forms, Voss develops interest in how systems navigate toward destinations they've never visited.
Sareth Moll begins her systematic ghost research, asking the question that would define her career: 'If the substrate is gone, what persists?'
Jackson enrolls at Klutch CC as part of the Class of 912. The level mismatch (Level 4 individual in Level 3 collective) will prove critical—Jackson can see the collective's goals from outside.

Kella Vorn transitions from clinical healer to researcher after seven years treating patients. 'For seven years, I thought my task was to restore the broken to wholeness. I was wrong.' Begins systematic documentation of failure cases across all domains—boundaries, navigation, ghosts, horizons, federations.

Senior Authenticator Vrell Tormon retires after 32 years. The Archive has his decision logs—comprehensive records required since Year 855. This becomes the paradigmatic case of method extraction: within 36 months, authentication accuracy will drop 12%.

Kellis Vorn leaves the Capital Archive following a dispute over method-disclosure requirements. After 17 years of field documentation work, she refuses to submit to the expanded disclosure policies. This departure marks the beginning of her theoretical work on method privacy.

Tessyn Korr is appointed to lead a new division at the Bureau: the Mechanism Cartography school. Unlike earlier researchers who treated prediction engines as black boxes, Korr will insist that every computation must be explicable.

Melleth Cord, a student of Vornis Keth specializing in boundary dynamics, joins the Bureau of Computational Standards. She brings expertise in phase transitions from her five-year survey of the Dens boundary.

Tobben Rast is appointed to lead initialization studies at the Bureau. His systematic approach to starting conditions will reveal that initialization variance often exceeds method variance in determining outcomes.

Prenn Vash is appointed to develop extraction methods at the Capital Archives. Her expertise in isolating concepts from tangled representations will prove foundational for understanding superposition in prediction engines.
The Inference Division is born
Morwen becomes the voice of caution: 'Trust, but verify. Always verify.'
Distinct from Archives — focus on mapping rather than classification
Vastos: 'The user should never need to see our code'
Krenn: 'The Boss taught us that ugly things can be effective. Generic traps catch nothing in this quarry.'
Ox teaches the overfitting trap
Mivros: 'An oracle that speaks falsehood is worse than silence.'
Nomis: 'A model that scored well yesterday may score poorly tomorrow'
Young evaluator, eager to try every new release
Not to be confused with Vornis Keth the surveyor
Dren demands principled decisions, not ad-hoc cleaning
Separate from extraction — focuses on authenticity testing
Vivian's methods involve deliberately leaving puzzles incomplete, teaching through absence. Students discover patterns while she appears to sleep.
Cassie arrives for algebra tutoring. Vivian leaves her alone with an incomplete ice-fishing puzzle - one piece deliberately missing.
Quonxy is an older woman who uses puzzles to teach addiction resistance. Her methods differ from Vivian's.
Creation of the Archivist of Visual Methods position recognized the need for systematic preservation of visual traditions.
Grell becomes first Chief Oracle, elevating the role from archival function to institutional position. The Oracle Chamber formalized as a distinct wing.
Imported from SIM-009
Imported from SIM-010
Imported from SIM-011
